speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's our show for today.  Don't forget - Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe is up next. [_Roz gestures for him to read a promo_] Oh, yes. [_reading_] This is KACL Cash Call Week.  $5,000 if you answer your phone with the phrase that pays.  So when your phone rings, don't say hello, say...

speaker: Frasier
text: WELL, BLOW ME DOWN!!!  Uh...no, no, no.  Say, uh... KACL is, uh... the talk of the town... talk of Seattle, whatever, Bye-bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sam, Sam! [_they hug_] Oh my God!  Well, what are you doing in town?

speaker: Sam
text: Uh, well actually I'm here interviewing for a job.  The Mariners need a pitching coach and they gave me a call.

speaker: Frasier
text: They did?

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean, that's great, but... [_off Sam's look_] well, come on in.

speaker: Sam
text: This is all right?  You're off the air?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah, it's fine.

speaker: Roz
text: [_entering from her booth_] Fras, I gotta go.  Your messages are on my desk and... [_sees Sam_] whoa, who is this?

speaker: Sam
text: I'm Sam Malone.  I was a buddy of Frasier's in Boston.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is Roz Doyle.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Frasier_] So this is the Sam Malone you've always talked about?  The one who has no respect for women and treats them like dirt? [_to Sam_] Need anyone to show you around Seattle?

speaker: Sam
text: Well, you know, to tell you the truth I'm all right with the city, but I get real lost in my hotel room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, boy.  Just look at the two of you face to face.  I imagine wild animals all over the Northwest are lifting their heads, alerted to the scent.  Good-bye, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, if you need any company, give me a call. [_hands him a card_] Here's my number.

speaker: Sam
text: Well, thanks.  That's a snazzy card.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it glows in the dark.

speaker: Roz
text: So do I.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, uh, how's everybody at Cheers?

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, wow.  Uh, well, let's see... you know that Rebecca finally married that plumber?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes... it's ironic, isn't it?  You know, she spends all her energy trying to land some rich guy and she ends up with an ordinary plumber.

speaker: Sam
text: Well, that ordinary plumber struck gold.  He's got a patent on some low-flow toilet thing.  I mean, he's rich beyond her wildest dreams.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, heck, I'm happy for her.

speaker: Sam
text: Well, don't be - he dumped her.  She's back at the bar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Working at Cheers again?

speaker: Sam
text: No, she's just back at the bar.  Hey, you know, here's some good news: Woody and Kelly, they had a baby boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that is wonderful! [_pauses_] Is he...?

speaker: Sam
text: No, he's smart.  He's smart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Well, genetics takes a holiday, huh? [_chuckles_] So, Sam, you want to continue this over some lunch?

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, I'd like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as they walk out into the hall_] So, are Norm and Cliff still holding up the bar?

speaker: Sam
text: Uh, well, Norm is, but Cliff hasn't been in for a while. Evidently, he read this article about flesh-eating bacteria and he hasn't left his mom's house since.  But, you know, there's a good side to that, though, 'cause a lot of people who haven't been around for a while are starting to come back to the bar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! **MARTIN RISES FROM THE DEAD**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment Later that evening: Daphne is setting the table for dinner._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daph, Sam was a major league ballplayer.  Put out the good china.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, and while you're at it don't forget the Limoges spittoon.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, as far as I'm concerned, Sam Malone's the most important person ever to set foot in this apartment.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_taking up the plates_] I don't understand this American obsession with sports figures.  They're all so superficial.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, it's not like they do anything real important like sit on a throne or christen ships. [_he calls out as he and Daphne enter the kitchen_] Hey, Niles, why didn't you bring Maris tonight?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm supposed to ask Maris to spend an evening with a baseball player? [_chuckles_] Why don't I just ask her to rub my shoulders?

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are, Sam.

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, wow, look at this.  Man, you got quite a babe magnet here.

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] Oh, Sam Malone!  Hey, I'm Marty Crane, I'm one of your biggest fans! [_they shake hands_] Yeah, I was at the Kingdome the night you gave up four consecutive home runs.  I bet you remember that, don't you?

speaker: Sam
text: Well, actually I don't.  You see, that was during my drinking phase.  Did I hit anybody?  Did I hurt them?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, hey, then that was a good game!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Sam, this is my chair.  You want to sit in it?

speaker: Sam
text: Oh... [_he starts, then is clearly put off_] yeah... well, maybe later.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll keep it warm for you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Sam, this is my brother, Dr. Niles Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Pleasure to meet you. [_shakes hands_]

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, you too.  Wow... man, this is freaky. [_to Frasier_] He looks just like you did when I met you. What happened, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Wasn't exactly a health club you were running there, Sam. [_walks over to get a drink_]

speaker: Sam
text: [_to Niles_] This is strange. I gotta tell you, I didn't know he had a brother.

speaker: Niles
text: [_glares at Frasier, then_] Frasier, I don't mind telling you I'm a little offended that in all the time you spent swapping you had a brother?!

speaker: Sam
text: Well, you know, the truth is, I bet he said something, it's just that when Frasier gets going you kind of have to tune him out.

speaker: Niles
text: That's a good slogan for his radio show - "Dr. Frasier Crane: when he gets going, you have to tune him out."

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, what did he tell you about me, Sam?  His father, the old cop?

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, yeah, you I remember.  Um, he told me you were dead.

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns to Frasier, stunned_] Dead?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we had had an argument.  You called me a stuffed shirt and hung up on me.  I was mad.

speaker: Sam
text: You're a cop? [_to Frasier_] You told me he was a research scientist.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off Martin's glare_] You were dead, what did it matter?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne... Daphne, this is Sam Malone.  Sam, this is Daphne Moon, Dad's physical therapist

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enchanted_] Well, it's a pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne's from England.

speaker: Sam
text: [_taking Daphne's hand_] Yeah, boy, I've always been a sucker for the English accent.  No matter what you say, it always sounds so classy and sophisticated.  _Daphne response comes out as girlish giggles and flustered gibberish._

speaker: Sam
text: See what I mean?  It kills me every time. [_Daphne reaches to get a plate off the table_] Hey, let me get that for you. A pretty lady like you shouldn't spend her whole evening in the kitchen.  _Daphne giggles again as she and Sam exit to the kitchen. Niles strides over to Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Is it my imagination, or is Sam flirting with Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course he's flirting with her.  He flirts with everyone. He can't help it, he's a sexual compulsive.  But he's getting help for it in a support group.

speaker: Niles
text: Did he miss a meeting?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  You'd like to speak to Sam? Um... [_Sam enters from the kitchen_] well, who's calling, please?  Sheila?

speaker: Frasier
text: Um... yes, well, he's not here right now, but I'm expecting him soon.

speaker: Sam
text: [_whispering_] No!  Number two!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Uh... I'm sorry, I'm sorry.  I was mistaken. He WAS here, but, uh, he left.  Well, yes, I'll give him the message.  Thank you. [_hangs up_] I'm sorry, Sam, I'm a little out of practice.  So, uh, who's Sheila?

speaker: Sam
text: Just the um... woman I'm supposed to marry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Marry?  When?

speaker: Sam
text: Uh, oh boy.  Um, yesterday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yesterday?

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah... I don't want to talk about it, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Sam...

speaker: Sam
text: Fras, please?  Just...

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, wow.  Hey, something sure smells yummy here. [_leans in close to Daphne_] Oh, wait a second, I think it's me.   _Scene Three - Frasier's apartment. Later that evening: Sam and Martin are chatting while Frasier and Niles look on._

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Sam, one more.

speaker: Sam
text: All right, let's see.  Uh... 1949, Yankees, initials V.R.

speaker: Martin
text: Vic Raschi.

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, you're great. [_to Frasier and Niles_] He's amazing. All you have to do is give him the city, the date and the initials and he gets it every time.

speaker: Niles
text: That's very similar to a game Frasier and I play. [_to Frasier_] I'll go first.  1962, Prague Philharmonic, viola section, initials C.M.

speaker: Frasier
text: Czeslaw Milovicz.

speaker: Niles
text: Wrong, wrong, wrong!  No, no, no--I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Milovicz was first viola the year before, but by '62 he'd developed Rosin poisoning and was no longer able to pluck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn!  That's a trick question!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm off to bed. [_Sam helps him up from his chair_] Thanks, Sam.  The chair's all yours!  Come on!

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, yeah... that's very nice.

speaker: Martin
text: 'Night, all. [_exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering from the kitchen_] I'll be turning in, too.

speaker: Niles
text: Pleasant dreams.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_chuckling_] Well, no problem there. [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess I'd better be getting back to my Maris.  If the clock strikes twelve and she hasn't felt my kiss upon her forehead she gets nervous. [_puts on his coat_] Sam, it's been a pleasure meeting you.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, you too.  Hey listen... if you want to really put a smile on Maris's face let me tell you what you do.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly where am I supposed to find whipped cream and a car battery at this hour?

speaker: Sam
text: You got neighbors, dontcha?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Sam, now that everybody's gone, there was something I wanted to bring up.  I just - what is it, what is it... Oh yes, yes, I remember: what the hell do you mean you were about to get married?!

speaker: Sam
text: [_stands_] All right, all right.  Uh, well, I met this girl six months ago and we were supposed to get married.  And yesterday I was standing in this church facing this minister and I hear him say, "Will you take this woman to be your wife?" and I said, "Who, me?"  The next thing you know I'm running down the aisle and I didn't stop running till I got here.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you're not in Seattle because of the Mariners?

speaker: Sam
text: Believe me, no ballplayer is in Seattle because of the Mariners.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Sam, let's have a seat here and start this thing from the very beginning. [_they sit at the dinner table_] Now, who is this woman?

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, she's a terrific person.  She's smart, she's funny, she's horny.  I mean, she's just the kind of chick you want to stick up on a pedestal.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Sam, it's always amazed me how you can elevate and demean in the same sentence.

speaker: Sam
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Forget it, just...

speaker: Sam
text: Well, how do you think she found me here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's my guess, Sam, that you left a lot of clues as to where you were because, basically you wanted her to find you.  I have a feeling that you actually want to marry this girl.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah?  I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Sam, all that happened was you panicked.  It's perfectly natural.  The wedding ceremony represents the end of your old life.

speaker: Sam
text: I tell you, man, she's one in a million, you know?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, for most guys that's just an expression.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Sam, I have a feeling that you're finally ready for a commitment like this.  I think you ought to get on that phone and call her.

speaker: Sam
text: What would I say to her, though?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, just tell her you panicked and ran.  Tell her the truth.  I mean, after all, honesty is the cornerstone of a healthy relationship.

speaker: Sam
text: Hey, thank you. [_they hug_] You know, it's time I stepped up to the plate and stopped acting like a kid. [_picks up the phone_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.  Geez, the only question now is, will she still take you back?  _Sam laughs at the very idea.  Frasier, realizing who he is talking to, joins in the laughs and they high-five each other._  _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **A DIRTY LITTLE SECRET**  _Scene One - Cafe Nervosa. Frasier, Roz and Niles are seated at a back table at the Cafe, discussing Sam's situation._

speaker: Roz
text: She actually forgave him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes... More than that, she's on her way here in a plane right now.  They're going to get married in Hawaii.

speaker: Roz
text: Same old story.  Love triumphs over Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, don't be a sore loser, will you, please?  Look, I invited them here on their way in from the airport.

speaker: Niles
text: I remember my wedding day.  Standing at the altar, feeling faint, shaky, sweating.  I remember Maris was so distraught thinking I might have cold feet.  I'll never forget how relieved she was to learn that it was just a congenital heart murmur that would plague me for the rest of my life.

speaker: Sam
text: Hey, everybody.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Sam! [_standing_]

speaker: Sam
text: Here she is - the future Mrs. Sam Malone.  Sheila, this is Frasier.

speaker: Sheila
text: Hello, Frasier, it's nice to finally meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sheila, likewise.  Uh, this is Roz and Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Sheila
text: Thank you.

speaker: Sam
text: You want to sit down?  I'll get us some coffee or something.

speaker: Sheila
text: No, actually Sam, it was sort of a long flight.  I was hoping maybe to go back to the hotel and freshen up.

speaker: Sam
text: Well, all right, whatever. [_to Frasier_] Hey, will you join us for dinner about 8:00?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.  Right... right.

speaker: Sam
text: Great.  All right.  Uh, well I guess we're off to [_suggestively_] freshen up a little.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my god.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, she was cute but she's not an, "Oh, my god."

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no.  Not that "Oh, my god."  Oh, my god, I slept with that woman three months ago.

speaker: Roz
text: You slept with _her_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: On what desert island with no hope of rescue was this?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glares, then_] I was... I was in Boston for a long weekend. [_sits_] I was feeling a little depressed, so I took solace in the arms of a... a beautiful and remarkably welcoming young woman in a hotel bar.

speaker: Niles
text: And that was she?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles.  I told you that for absolutely no reason whatsoever.  Of course it was she!  Did you see the way she ran out of here the minute she saw me?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, yes.  The trademark of all your bedmates. [_pause_] Wait a minute.  Three months ago?  Didn't Sam say they'd been together for six months?

speaker: Roz
text: [_putting on makeup_] Well, it looks like this horse race is on again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, put the weapon down! [_shuts her compact_] Stop it, Roz! Have you no scruples whatsoever?

speaker: Roz
text: You're the one who slept with your friend's fiancee!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't know that at the time!

speaker: Niles
text: Surely you have to tell Sam about this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what, and ruin our relationship as well as theirs?!  What I've got to do is, actually I've got to speak to her first. Hear her side of this story.  I mean, after all, there are hundreds of reasons why people have affairs.

speaker: Niles
text: Roz, you want to get us started? [_she shoots him a dirty look_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles. [_puts on his coat_] Well, there's got to be some explanation.  Maybe they stopped seeing each other for a couple of weeks.  Maybe Sam cheated on her and she was just doing it to get even with him.  Or, who knows?  Maybe she just found me completely irresistible.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, that's it. [_chuckles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!

speaker: Roz
text: You struck gold there, Frasier!  _Roz and Niles laugh as he storms out of the Cafe.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Sheila's hotel room. Later that evening: Frasier knocks on the door and Sheila answers._

speaker: Sheila
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Sheila.  Good to see you again. [_calling out_] Sam, you are one lucky guy!

speaker: Sheila
text: He's out getting our plane tickets.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good.  Look, you have some explaining to do, young lady!

speaker: Sheila
text: Okay, okay.  Wine?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you.

speaker: Sheila
text: Look... first of all, I know this doesn't excuse what I did, but I had no idea that you were a friend of Sam's.  I'm a sexual compulsive.  It's how Sam and I met - in group.  Look, that night I spent with you - I guess I just kind of fell off the wagon.  What I did was terrible.  I felt awful afterwards. It ended up being a kind of turning point for me.  That's how it is with addiction; before you can get better you have to hit rock bottom.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_insulted_] Yes.  Well... I'm glad I could be down there for you.

speaker: Sheila
text: Listen, Frasier - I'm human, I made a mistake.  Can you understand that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course I can understand, Sheila.  And I sympathize. [_sits with her on the couch_] I've had many patients that share your affliction... although, to date you're the only one I've met who can hit the emergency button of an elevator with a stiletto heel.

speaker: Sheila
text: I want you to know that I love Sam and I'm going to do everything I can to make this marriage work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you certainly do seem sincere about this.  I think, in all good conscience I can support this marriage, but I want you to know if you start to feel yourself slipping, here's my number. [_he hands her his card, which stuns her_] No, no, no... so I can help you as a psychiatrist!

speaker: Sheila
text: Oh!  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and... I think it's probably best if maybe we don't tell Sam about the two of us.

speaker: Sheila
text: Agreed.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not that I have a guilty conscience or anything.

speaker: Sam
text: I'm back.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_leaping from the couch_] Yaahh!!

speaker: Sam
text: You all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Got a little charley horse, Sam.

speaker: Sheila
text: Did you get the tickets, Sam?

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, I did.  They're right here. [_sits beside her_]

speaker: Sheila
text: I'm so happy.  By this time tomorrow we'll be Mr. and Mrs. Sam Malone. [_they kiss_]

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah... um, I want to talk to you about that.  Um, Frasier said something the other day that really stuck in my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a first.  What did I say?

speaker: Sam
text: You know, that thing about honesty being something... of something... it was pro-honesty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Being the cornerstone of a good relationship?

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, right.  Well, that really stuck in my mind.  Uh...to tell you the truth, I haven't really been honest with you, Sheila.

speaker: Sheila
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Sam
text: When we get married I want us to have a clean slate sweetheart, you know?  Boy, I hope you can forgive me for this, but a few months ago, I had a slip.  Actually, I had two slips but they happened simultaneously so I'm counting it as one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Was this after you were engaged?

speaker: Sam
text: Uh, actually, it was that night. [_to Sheila_] I'm... I'm so sorry.  Listen, it has not happened since and I swear to God it will not happen again.

speaker: Sheila
text: Sam, I forgive you.

speaker: Sam
text: You do?

speaker: Sheila
text: Actually, I'm relieved, because I have something that I need to confess to you.  You're not the only one who... slipped.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nervous_] You know... I think it's time you guys had a little privacy. [_gets his coat_]

speaker: Sam
text: No, no.  Frasier, you're responsible for getting us this far. Now, we have no secrets. [_to Sheila_] All right.  Who?

speaker: Sheila
text: Well, that's what makes it so tough.  It was someone from Cheers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh... you know, I just remembered.  I parked in a loading zone.  I'd better...

speaker: Sheila
text: Sam, I slept with Paul. _This briefly stuns both Frasier and Sam. (Fans of "Cheers" who remember Paul will understand why.)_

speaker: Frasier
text: Paul?  Short...

speaker: Sam
text: Bald...

speaker: Frasier
text: Fat...

speaker: Sam
text: Paul?

speaker: Sheila
text: I didn't say he was good. [_gets up_]

speaker: Sam
text: Well, you know - all right, I understand that. [_gets up_] You were giving Paul a break or something, you know? And I can forgive that. [_to Frasier_] This is what this is all about, isn't it - forgiveness?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes. [_on thin ice_] Okay, you told one, you told one, that's great, we're all even-steven!  Let's go eat.

speaker: Sheila
text: There was someone else...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frantically upbeat_] What, are we still on this?!  _Geez_ -- I mean, there is honesty and there's beating a dead horse!

speaker: Sam
text: It doesn't matter.  I don't care.  It doesn't matter who it is.

speaker: Sheila
text: Yes, it does matter, Sam.  I mean, this one is really embarrassing.  I was lonely, I was desperate and I'd just been to the eye doctor and my pupils were dilated...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Sheila, for God's sake!  Look, I'll tell him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sam, what's she's trying to say is...

speaker: Sheila
text: It was Cliff.

speaker: Sam
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I believe she said "Cliff."

speaker: Sam
text: Cliff?  Cliff... you?  You slept with Cliff?  _CLIFF?!_  Oh no, that's it, wedding's off! [_storms off to a bedroom_] Cliff - oh, God!

speaker: Sheila
text: Whoa... Frasier, you've got to help me.  You've got to talk to him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I slept with a woman who slept with Cliff?! _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's car. That same evening: Frasier is driving Sam to the airport._

speaker: Sam
text: Oh, boy.  It's gonna be a long flight home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I know it was painful, Sam, but you made the right decision.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, I suppose. [_then:_] Geez... Cliff!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're just using Cliff as the excuse.  We both know there were more compelling reasons for you to back out of this thing.

speaker: Sam
text: Hmm... No, it was Cliff.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Sam, to put this thing aside once and for all, I...

speaker: Sam
text: Do you realize you're probably the only friend I have who she didn't sleep with? [_he eyes Frasier suspiciously_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Cliff. [_chuckles weakly_] That is a tough one to swallow, huh? But, you know the important thing is that you proved to yourself that you're ready for a commitment even if Sheila wasn't the one.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah... I suppose so.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, in a way we're both in the same boat.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah?  What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know... we've tried, we've failed.  But we'll try again.  Sam, we're looking for a meaningful relationship.

speaker: Sam
text: Yeah, that's it. That's the word right there - "meaningful."

speaker: Frasier
text: We're gonna find it though, buddy.  I tell you.

speaker: Sam
text: You bet we will. [_pause_] You know, stewardesses usually hang out at that airport bar.

speaker: Frasier
text: That says meaningful to me. _They chuckle good-naturedly and Sam claps his hands in excitement as the scene fades out.  END OF ACT TWO_
